title: Derby BLT Dip Recipe
description: An easy dip with the delicious taste of a BLT is ready almost instantly. Just mix the simple ingredients and serve. Refrigerate overnight for even better flavor.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Recipes Cheese Dips and Spreads Recipes Derby BLT Dip 4.3 (11) 9 Reviews 5 Photos We were down in Kentucky to meet my niece's fiance and his friends and family and found this dip. Thought I'd pass it on. Can be served with veggies, but I liked it best with Triscuits®. I was surprised by this dip. I only tried it because of the crackers. For better flavor, make the day before so the flavors can meld. Can also be made by leaving out bacon and adding 1/2 cup slivered almonds or finely chopped pecans. Submitted by Suzanne Marzano Updated on July 9, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 32 Yield: 4 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 32 servings 1 cup sour cream 1 cup creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip®) 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese 1 cup seeded and chopped Roma tomatoes 1 (3 ounce) jar real bacon bits 1 tablespoon chopped green onion Directions Mix sour cream, creamy salad dressing, Cheddar cheese, tomatoes, and bacon bits in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Refrigerate until serving time; served topped with green onion. I Made It Print 26 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 63 Calories 5g Fat 2g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 32 Calories 63 % Daily Value * Total Fat 5g 7% Saturated Fat 2g 11% Cholesterol 11mg 4% Sodium 171mg 7% Total Carbohydrate 2g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 0% Total Sugars 1g Protein 2g 5% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 35mg 3% Potassium 28mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Derby BLT Dip 01 of 05 Photo by  Cooking with Shelia 02 of 05 Photo by  CookingWithShelia 06/25/2024 Although I liked the dip, I do believe the flavor is heavy on the miracle whip side (I'm not a fan). I added green onions after my initial taste and I think it definitely added flavor. The next time I make it, I'll use real bacon instead of the real bacon bits... 03 of 05 Photo by  Laura Davis 01/16/2019 I omitted the cheese and added shredded lettuce. Serve chilled with potato chips or crackers! YUM 04 of 05 Photo by  Melanye Blackshear 04/25/2018 05 of 05 Photo by  lovestohost 04/23/2012 This came together quickly and was tasty, but I didn't LOVE it. It wasn't that dip that I just can't stay out of, but it was a very nice dip. I liked the tomatoes and the smokiness of the bacon. Thanks for sharing the recipe, Suzanne. 1 You’ll Also Love Barbecue-Bacon Party Spread 7 Ratings BBQ Bacon Ranch Dip 161 Ratings Sausage Dip 2 Ratings Warm Blue Cheese Dip with Garlic and Bacon 279 Ratings Bacon and Dill Pickle Cheese Ball 2 Ratings Bacon Avocado Cream Cheese Dip 4 Ratings Chorizo Queso Dip 40 Ratings Best Cheese Dip 17 Ratings Chorizo con Queso 1 Rating Emily's Easy Sausage and Spicy Tomato Dip 72 Ratings Sausage Cheese Dip 36 Ratings Hot Sausage Dip 87 Ratings Hidden Valley Bacon & Cheddar Dip 11 Ratings Ree Drummond's Queso Fundido 4 Ratings Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip 278 Ratings ChoriQueso 11 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Suzanne Marzano
instructions: Mix sour cream, creamy salad dressing, Cheddar cheese, tomatoes, and bacon bits in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Refrigerate until serving time; served topped with green onion.
